message.name: RUDDER_RAW
message.description: This message encodes all of the raw rudder sensor data from the USV.
message.field: The raw data from the position sensor, generally a potentiometer.
Status of the rudder limit sensor, port side. 0 indicates off and 1 indicates that the limit is hit. If this sensor is inactive set to 0xFF.
Status of the rudder limit sensor, port side. 0 indicates off and 1 indicates that the limit is hit. If this sensor is inactive set to 0xFF.
Status of the rudder limit sensor, starboard side. 0 indicates off and 1 indicates that the limit is hit. If this sensor is inactive set to 0xFF.

message.name: RUDDER_INT
message.description: Gives rudder angle in real-world units
message.field: Holds the raw value that indicates the port limit. Used for mapping the raw ADC values into real units.
Holds the raw value that indicates the starboard limit. Used for mapping the raw ADC values into real units.
The interpreted rudder angle in milliradians.

message.name: PROP_RAW
message.field: Propeller speed, positive values mean the vessel will be propelled forward. Units are in RPM.

message.name: WIND_RAW
message.description: Returns the raw wind sensor values.
message.field: Wind speed in cm/s.
Wind direction in e-4 rads east from north.

message.name: AIR_RAW
message.description: Returns the raw air sensor values.
message.field: Air temperature in cdegrees Celsius.
Air pressure in hectorPascals.
Air humidity in units of .0004%.

message.name: WATER_RAW
message.field: Water speed in mm/s.
Water temperature in centidegrees Celsius.
Water depth in centimeters (DST800 range is 100m). Invalid measurements are 0xFFFF.

message.name: STATUS_AND_ERRORS
message.description: Status and error bits from operation.
message.field: Status bitfield. Bits are active-high and ordered as: 0-reset/startup, 1-reset_hil_toggle, 2-reset_HIL_discon, 3-reset_GPS-discon, 4-reset_track, 5-reset_calibrating, 6-reset_uncalibrated, 7-reset_estrop, 8-auto_mode, 9-hil_sensors_mode, 10-rc_disconnected.
Errors bitfield. Bits are active-high and ordered as: 0-ECAN_TX_err, 1-ECAN_RX_err.

message.name: ACTUATOR_COMMANDS
message.description: The commands from the controller (either autopilot or user) for both actuators.
message.field: Commanded rudder angle in milliradians where positive indicates port-side.
Commanded throttle speed in units of 1/1023*100% of max current and positive values propel the vehicle forward.

message.name: L2
message.description: This message packages the L2 vector used by the L2+ controller. It's provided in a North-East-Down coordinate system.
message.field: North-coordinate of the L2 vector in mm.
East-coordinate of the L2 vector in mm.
